alert.note: Alert for Eastern Essex; Eastern King and Queen; Lancaster; Richmond (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 11:35PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central King and Queen, southeastern Richmond, southeastern Essex and northwestern Lancaster Counties through MIDNIGHT EDT... At 1135 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Stevensville, or 7 miles north of King And Queen Court House, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Center Cross and Dunnsville around 1145 PM EDT. Sharps around 1155 PM EDT. Farnham, Morattico and Haynesville around 1200 AM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Laneview, Howertons, Wellford, Somers, Upright, Bowlers Wharf, Ino, Belle Isle State Park, Montague and Downing. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM EDT for east central Virginia. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 100 AM EDT for eastern and east central Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Essex; Eastern King and Queen; Lancaster; Richmond
